CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 15, 1954, pg. 1, reads: "Two Tots Die in 7 Feet Deep Creek, 150 Feet From Home - Desolate Father - George W. Adams Sr. of 14 Walnut Street, stands desolately along the Chartiers Creek bank, about 150 feet from his home, where his two youngsters [illegible] indicated that two-year-old Calvin first stumbled into the seven-feet deep waters, and George Jr., apparently stepped into the swollen creek in an effort to save his brother - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: George W. Adams Sr. standing beside Chartiers Creek, site of drowning deaths of two of his sons, Carnegie
